content.description:
From Bob Milko:

All That Chas 3 pitch 60 m bolted sport route on Whitman’s Crag above Canmore developed by Bob Milko as a tribute to Chas Yonge who passed away in January and who was a great friend to many Bow Valley Climbers and beyond. It is 3 short pitches between Sharknado and Hot Fuzz on Whiteman Crag above Canmore.

 First ascent July 17 2020 by Bob Milko and Chris Perry 

P.1  5.9 20m. 8 bolts ….start 5 meters uphill from Hot fuzz on Whitman’s Crag on the slab just left of a prominent white streak.  Follow bolts up the slab going straight up over a bulge using a hidden hold above and left of the bolt protecting the overhang move and then traverse across a ledge stepping across to a short face with 2 bolts to the 2 ring anchor. 

P.2  5.10b 25 m. 10 bolts….straight up from the anchor through 2 small overhangs and then up a fairly sustained face to a 2 ring anchor. avoid using holds in the loose rock band on the left 

P.3 5.8 15 m. 5 bolts…traverse left for 2 meters and straight up the steep slab exiting with a fun and easy layback 

Rappel all three stations to avoid going over the loose rock band 60m rope and 10 draws including 1 alpine draw



Underneath the big roof between Sharknado and Hot Fuzz. Find the line of bolts that contour the roof to the right, left of the big gully.

Fully bolted.

climbs.name: Die Young Stay Pretty
climbs.fa: S. Scott & M. Sawyer, July 1979; Bulky Boys Finish: T. Jones & R. Felber, 1998

content.description:
The route starts with 5.7 climbing on the first pitch. Pitch 2 continues with run-out 5.7 slab climbing to the crux left facing corner crack. This vertical crack/corner is protected by very rusty old pitons. A #1 wire can be slotted below the first piton as you start the crack.

Rapel the route on double ropes or walk off left on ledges though, walking off is not recommended because you may knock rocks onto the road below. 

Located just past Grassi Lakes at the South end of Whiteman Crag. The route climbs above the Spray Lakes Road so avoid dropping/cleaning rocks as the may land on the road. 
nuts, cams

Godzilla is the newest addition to the fun short multipitch routes bolted by Brandon Pullan at Kanga Crag. It climbs some great rock but as a new-ish route there is still some loose rock so like any rockies climbs a helmet is strongly recommended. The route can be done with 10 quickdraws and a 70 meter rope although might be possible with a 60 meter as all pitches are just about 30 meters.

As mentioned above, helmets are a must but please be careful not to throw any rocks down on the road below.

P1: 5.7, 10 bolts. This pitch starts next to a tree and follows an arrete until you get to a comfortable belay ledge. The tree at the end of the pitch is good to grab.

P2: 5.9, 6 bolts. The crux pitch, follow a leftward line of bolts to a small roof, around the arrete to a few exposed moves on a slab. Once over the ledge, walk to the anchor.

P3: 5.8, 8 bolts. Start up a sweet right facing corner onto some face climbing. You'll reach a steep bulge eventually, at this point clip the bolt and trend left for some more fun climbing. Mantle to belay ledge.

P4: 5.9, 10 bolts. Arguably the best rock of this climb. Pass some trees (right or left doesn't matter) to a corner slab. Stay left of bolts until stem move that leads you into thin slab climbing to belay ledge.

Descent: 4 30 meter rappels. For the third rappel, aim to rappel straight down the chimney instead of around the crux arrete. Be careful of falling rock when pulling the rope.null

This is the leftmost route at the crag. Same approach as for hot fuzz & sharknado, but once at the base of these climbs head left on a trail that brings you to a tree in a corner. Use photo for reference. 
10 quickdraws, 70 meter rope, helmets. Fully bolted.

Pitch 1: Slab climbing on sticky limestone diagonally to the left, with a short 3 m traverse to the hidden anchor on loose flakes; Pitch 2: Stemming in gullies and climbing an arete to an anchor. Descent: Rappel from 2nd pitch to 1st pitch anchor, and then fall line to an anchor 15 m above the ground. Some potential for rockfall and stuck ropes. Park as for Grassi then walk up road a bit and turn right up scree slope before 35km/hr sign. On the left side of the big roof Pitch 1: 11 bolts
Pitch 2: 10 bolts
Gear: 12 quick draws, 70 m rope. All anchors bolted with rap rings.

Pretty decent climb that works the arete and gully. Watch for loose rock

Park as for Grassi then walk up road a bit and turn right up scree slope before 35km/hr sign. On the right side of the big roof
bolts and rap stations
Home of a few newer classics. Just north of Whitman Pond.
